page.title: 09LYME REGIS SEWAGE PROBLEM
page.content: Raw sewage is discharged into the sea at low-water from two ancient iron pipes, one just west of the Cobb, the other off the East beach. Raw sewage is often washed up both here and at Charmouth. The western pipe is sometimes fractured by gale-driven rocks; repair is not prompt, the result is disgusting. Planners favour a treatment plant and deep-sea outfall but persist in choosing the most obtrusive place, Cobb Gate, for this building. Objections result in public enquiries, a Royal Commission, rejection and more delay. An amended plan to place the treatment plant further east, below the Marine Theatre, is under protracted consideration by the local authority and the responsible body- The South West Water Board.
